Description:
TANKS: The Modern Age is an easy-to-learn, quick-play, small-scale game, where you take command of a Tank Platoon, seeking to destroy your opponent's tanks and secure victory.

The Leopard 2 is a West German tank.
Families: Game: TANKS – The Modern Age (Battlefront / GF9)

Name: TANKS: The Modern Age – T-64 Tank Expansion
Description:
TANKS: The Modern Age is an easy-to-learn, quick-play, small-scale game, where you take command of a Tank Platoon, seeking to destroy your opponent's tanks and secure victory.

The T-64 tank expansion contains
- plastic T-64 Tank
- T-64 Tank Card
- Hero Card
- 2 Crew Cards
- 2 Upgrade Cards
Families: Game: TANKS – The Modern Age (Battlefront / GF9)

Name: Tanks: T-34 (Early) Tank Expansion
Description: The T-34 was the most-produced tank of World War II. When the German Wehrmacht first encountered it in battle in 1941, German tank generals von Kleist and Guderian called it "the deadliest tank in the world." The fast-moving T-34 tank was the mainstay of the Red Army's tank force throughout the war.

Name: Tanks: Lend Lease M3L Stuart Tank Expansion
Description: In Soviet service, the M3 light tank was designated as the M3L (L= legkhiy: light) to distinguish it from the M3 medium tank which was called the M3S (S= sredniy: medium). It was first put into action in the spring of 1942 in the fighting in the Kharkov area. During the course of the war the Soviet Union was shipped a wide variety of versions of the M3L and were widely used throughout the war.

Name: Tanks: Lend Lease M3S Lee Tank Expansion
Description: The first batch of M3S Lee tanks were sent over to Russia in October 1941. At first the M3-Lee tank confused Soviet tank designers with a hull mounted 75mm and a 37mm gun in its turret; the design was simply odd. The tank quickly proved itself to be a worthy fighting machine through its durability and reliability.

Name: Green Box of Games: The Meeple Mini Expansion
Description:
As a limited edition release for SPIEL '18, and following the design contest, there will be a small expansion for the Green Box of Games available. The expansion will include:


     Rulebook containing the 12 games from the contest, and possibly a few more
     A drawstring bag
     6 meeples, one in each color of red, blue, green, yellow, black and white
     20 black and 20 white cubes, so everything is available in 6 colors


—'description from the publisher

Name: 1 2 3... Conta Con Me!
Description:
Lots of numbers and many game modes to have fun and learn to count!
The 56 cards with numbers and quantities will help the child to exercise, from the earliest years of life, the mathematical intelligence, through the exercise of thinking in pictures.
The child will have to associate the cards with the numbers to the corresponding quantities thanks to the 4 fun game modes:
1 - Memory-like;
2 - Place the quantity cards faceup on the table, reveal 1 number card at a time, the first player to cover the matching quantity card collects it and the winner is the player with the most cards;
3 - UNO-like;
4 - Scopa-like.

Name: Tanks: KV Tank Expansion
Description: The KV tank was a new type of heavy tank, a rejection of the multi-turreted designs like the T-35 and T-28 that had dominated the 1930s. When Operation Barbarossa began, the Red Army had 508 new KV tanks. So effective was its armour that the Germans had to rely on pioneers with anti-tank mines and heavy anti-tank guns.

Name: A B C... Divertiamo!
Description:
Learning the alphabet will be easy and intuitive thanks to the 28 cards with letters and the 28 cards with images and words to associate with the corresponding initial!
A game that stimulates language and the exercise of imagination to have fun discovering the alphabet.
Four game modes:
1 - Memory-like;
2 - Place the image cards faceup on the table, reveal 1 letter card at a time, the first player to cover the matching image card collects it and the winner is the player with the most cards;
3 - Old Maid-like;
4 - Scopa-like.

Name: Tanks: Lend Lease Churchill Tank Expansion
Description: The first 25 Churchill tanks were delivered to the Soviet Union in May 1942. With its heavy armour and powerful 6pdr gun the Churchill made an excellent addition to the Guards breakthrough regiments. The Churchill's roof-mounted periscope so impressed Soviet tank designers that it influenced later periscopes installed in the T-34/85 and IS-2.

Name: Tanks: Lend Lease Valentine Tank Expansion
Description: Because the Valentine was so well-liked by the Soviets, the British government decided to direct nearly all of Canadian Valentine production to the Soviet Union. Over the war a total of 3,782 Valentines of various marks were sent to the Soviet Union.

Name: Candy Craze
Description:
You and your friends are going trick-or-treating together. Fill your basket with the right type and the best arrangement of candy to earn the most points and win the night!

On your turn, choose a house along your route at which to stop. Roll the dice, representing candy you could get at this house (an added 'spooky die' can add danger or candy to your roll). The dice face determines which area of your candy bag the item can be placed in, while you can choose which candy (or die) and what orientation the candy goes. Each player can choose which candy to take at this house, then the next player takes a turn.

A light game of push-your-luck with a bit of Tetris strategy to play for Halloween.

—description from the designer

Name: Fire in the Library: Technology
Description:
Technology Books are very valuable, but also very volatile. Adding in Technology Books to Fire in the Library adds in the chance to score a lot of Knowledge Points but could also lead to the early destruction of the Library!

—description from the publisher

Name: Hey Brother
Description:
Hey Brother is a game of hard-talking 1980s wrestlers for two or more players. Talk the best trash to make your opponent crack before you do, but try not to embarrass yourself in front of Mean Gene.

To start, randomly choose the first Monarch of the Mat. The Monarch challenges whichever other player they want, then spits a few lines of their best 1980s wrestling promo impersonation. Take turns back and forth until one of you loses your furious concentration. When someone cracks, the other player is now Monarch of the Mat and challenges any other player. Keep playing until everyone taps out. The final Monarch wins the title belt.

The game comes printed on a bandanna.

Name: Conga Mummies
Description:
Conga Mummies is a simple grid movement game for one to four players.  Each player controls a "mummy" token that moves about the board, square-by-square, as desired.  The gridded board is laid out roughly to approximate a humanoid form.  Players start in the "head" grid and then move to specific squares in each "hand" and "foot" to collect canopic jars containing organs.  All four embalmed organs (stomach, intestines, liver, and lungs) are required for the mummy to reach the afterlife.  The first player to recover all four of the needed organs wins the game.

Each grid square has a random chance (25%) of containing a beast; this is determined when the first character moves into the square.  Beasts, if encountered, must be defeated to proceed.  Individual mummies can take damage and be destroyed (the player loses and drops out of the game).

The primary innovation of the game involves player movement.  Players must move in a "conga line" pattern, following exactly in the leader's footsteps, but one to three squares behind (depending on how many players there are).  The line leader makes all decisions and performs all combat.  If desired, the line leader can yield their position (when low on health, for example) and move to the back of the line.  Alternately, each player can cast three "compel" spells during the game.  Each "compel" spell forces the leader to move to the back of the line.

The basic strategy is to remain at the back of the line (in safety) through the first three organ collections then to move (and remain) in the lead position for the final organ collection (thus, winning).

The game supports single-player play, though this becomes simply an exercise of trying to move and survive to the end, rather than managing the "conga line" strategy.

The game is provided as a four-page, print-and-play PDF document containing the rules and the game board.  It was distributed for free from various online sites.

—user summary

Name: SUMMONED: The Devil Inside Edition
Description:
SUMMONED "The Devil Inside" is a horror-based party card game that contains a full backstory that puts the players into the game themselves.

SUMMONED “the Devil Inside”, is the first of many planned extensions Attack from Marrs Games has for this game. They plan on doing future extensions. The extensions will have their own Spirit, ghost, zombie, etc.  With their own separate back-stories. SUMMONED is a party card game that contains a full back-story that puts the players into the game themselves. All players will start with a set of Curse Cards that players will use throughout the whole game. These cards contain Dares that the “Victims” (non-active players) can choose to complete or pass on. Each Curse Card is worth a point, so the Victims choices of taking and successfully completing a card will effect if the Victim earns or losses points. Players will take turns being a Demon, which is the active player of the game. Victims are the inactive players that are vulnerable to the Demon. Who can give one Victim Player a Curse Card at any moment. SUMMONED also features a Curse Ability Extension deck.  Curse Ability Cards are “Special Cards”; these cards are worth ½ point. Curse Ability Cards have benefits on them, which will help the Demon or Victim player. But these cards will be bad news for the apposing player. SUMMONED pulls together different types of game play, that creates a party card game that everyone will have a blast playing. Player can play this game sitting down, while you are out and about or as a live action RPG.

How can you play this game as a live action RPG? Well-SUMMONED “The Devil Inside” provides characters. The Demon and Victims, who will take turns turning each other into Demons by giving them a Curse. This Curse has a back-story. That starts out with a drunken friend who decided to wander off into a friend’s house. They find an Ouija board with etched words written on it. While they try to read these words they accidentally summons a Devil. The Devil was not a fan of being awoken, so he gave the drunken friend a curse that starts turning them into a Demon. To make things worse the only way to get rid of this curse is to get another person to perform actions from cards. Those were provided to the friend by the Devil himself. Players are able to bring their Demon characters to life while they are the active player. Being the active player you will use your Cards to pick off your Victims one by one. Trying to reduce the number of cards they have in their hand. Victim players in turn, will try their best to successfully complete these actions on the cards. Earning them more points.

SUMMONED “The Devil Inside” is for ages 21+, with approximately 60-90 mins of game play. Players can choose to continue their game for longer if wanted. SUMMONED “The Devil Inside” has  Curse Cards with a rule book containing; the story, rules and game play instructions. SUMMONED “The Devil Inside” has one extension pack (so far) that will be available, containing  Curse Ability Cards.

Name: Neolithic: Warfare Before the Beginning of Time
Description:
Neolithic: Warfare Before the Beginning of Time is a very simple wargame designed for small numbers (six to ten per side) of opposing units using non-metallic and simple weapons and armors.  Units are either various types of humans or animals.  Each unit typically has some specific single quality (e.g., a Spearman has a very high morale level, etc.).  The game is limited to two opposing forces; players alternate taking turns.  Checks in the game (morale, hit, etc.) are made using one or two ten-sided dice.

Units represent single combatants.  Morale checks are made for each unit under several circumstances; failed checks lead first to degraded morale, then to rout.  Movement is given in inches, and units may walk, run, or charge.  Rout (flee) movement is given in random inches.  During a turn, missile fire precedes mêlée and effects take place immediately (this gives considerable advantage to the player that moves first in the game).  Units sustaining damage can be killed or captured.

The game does not use scale and any "small" figures (generally, miniatures or tokens) may be used.

A player loses when all of their units are killed, captured, or routed.  Alternately, the players can agree upon victory conditions prior to the game (typically capturing specific units or routing a certain number of units to represent area control).

The game was provided as a downloadable PDF document, and at one time also was hosted online in HTML format.

—User Summary

Name: Flash Juice
Description:
Fruits and vegetables are really delicious if we process it into juice. But, we can’t get fruits and vegetables easily because of limited stock. We must compete with other player to get it fast. So, who will be the best juice maker in the town?

In this game, players are challenged to make a quick decision which fruit to get to make a juice, based on the customer dice. While each fruit card is being covered in the color specific cover, players must also remember which fruit is being associated with which color every time the customer dice is being rolled. The fist player who shout the correct fruit get the Fruit card.

The game ends when one of the player get his/her fifth fruit card, then that player is declared as the winner of the flash juice competition.

Name: All You Need Is Love
Description:
The “ALL YOU NEED IS LOVE” board game, based on the popular TV program.

Get to know one another better by asking personal questions. Good answers win hearts for you and your friend or partner. The hearts are used to earn a place in the middle of the board. But look out: there’s always another player on the love caravan, testing your friendship. The first two players to prove their ultimate friendship or unshakable relationship in the middle of the board will win the game. Can you win the convivial and humorous ‘All You Need Is Love’ board game together?

All you need is love is a board game where players do not need any knowledge except of that about their friends. Answer questions about each other and earn heart tokens to win the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: FusionPlay Heroes: Hero Pack – Titchy & Snooks
Description:
Titchy & Snooks - The tiny and the tarantula

This hero packs adds the Titchy, the young girl and her mutated spider friend "Snooks" to the game.

The Hero Pack contains everything that is needed to play with this new hero team.

Although they lack in strength and defense, Titchy and Snooks exceed all other heroes in agility. Their protection is evasion and their damage comes from a high critical hit chance. To support this, they have powerful buffs and debuffs to raise their own and lower the opponent’s dexterity. Playing them right means to prevent the opponent from hitting them.

Name: FusionPlay Heroes: Hero Pack – Kim Oh No
Description:
Kim Oh No - An ancient angry assassin

This hero packs adds Kim Oh No, the japanese assassin with his uncontrollable outbursts to the game.

The Hero Pack contains everything that is needed to play with this new hero.

With his excellent defense, Kim is protected very well against physical attacks. His strength lies in continuously inflicting wounds to the opponent. This always forces the opponent to decide whether to tolerate the wounds or change his strategy and cure them. Be careful when the opponent attacks with Mental attacks. “Inner Spirit” can help against that.

Name: FLIKKEN het bordspel
Description:
Solve a mysterious case at home in this intriguing board game, based on the popular Dutch TV series. Flikken is a dice rolling game where players solve a difficult case, while at the same time working to keep criminality under control and prevent the collapse of the city. Roll the dice, collect police tokens and place your forces in different zones to increase your control over the city. By controlling more zones in the city, players receive information about the mysterious case. 
Can you keep the streets safe and solve the case?

FLIKKEN is played with 2 to 4 players and takes about 45 minutes to play. The game mostly contains luck and a bit of strategy.

—description from the publisher

Name: Roll & Seek: The Museum
Description:
Roll & Seek is a twist on the classic game of Memory.

Lay out the museum tiles face down in a grid to create the floor plan of the museum. Take the two picture dice in hand and roll them. The dice will reveal the two locations in the museum where you will find your friends hiding. Flip two tiles to see if you've found them - if the tiles match the dice, you win the game.

If the tiles and dice don't match, just flip them back down and let your friends Roll & Seek.

The game also includes four special tiles with extra rules on them, for players that want to take their Roll & Seek game to the next level.

Name: Unsolved Mysteries: El Ancora de Fuego
Description:
Unsolved Mysteries: El Ancora de Fuego is an adventure, survival, mistery and terror game for 1 or 2 players that takes place in Japan in 1902.

It's 2018. William Carter is a Brooklyn detective who reopens and investigates unsolved cases, whose evidence was sinister and inconclusive or potentially supernatural. In his current case several mental patients escaped from an asylum and subsequently disappeared without a trace. Everything becomes darker as the investigation goes deeper and he finds evidence that the Yökai, demonic spirits and shadows, live amongst us. The players will be the protagonists of Carter's 1902 unsolved case and will join him on his journey through the darkness to discover the truth.

All the decisions made throughout the adventure will influence the development and the end of it. The game is designed to be played several times, since in a single game you can’t discover all its content. The players will choose two characters at the beggining from the three initials, being the story different according to who they play it with and unlocking other characters as the story goes on.

Each chapter of Unsolved Mysteries: El Ancora de Fuego is played on a board, using cards to represent places, interactions, objects and Yökai, and six special dices whose result when thrown will determine the possible options to be made, each of them will be read in the adventure book. During their turn, players can explore and interact with their surroundings, move to other locations, use objects and defend themselves or flee from the Yökai that will appear. Players should keep in mind their mental state, because the darkness lurks and they may fall into a nightmarish state in which their true personality is revealed. And when death comes, they can use the scarce Destiny Markers to avoid it ... temporarily.

The story goes through several chapters, some of them optional and secret, more than five endings, more than 300 different interactions and more than 50 different proofs to find.

Come and confront your fears in Unsolved Mysteries: El Ancora de Fuego!

—description from the publisher

Name: Murder Mystery Charades
Description:
If you can not do the mime you can't solve the crime

Read the clue then mime the murder to help solve the mystery! classic charades gets a wicked twist in this fast and furious update where you don't just have to guess whodunit but how and why!

—description from the publisher

Name: Grab Your Pitchforks and Torches!
Description:
This 2 player game is meant to be a quick pocket sized game to play when time is short.

You are trying to be the first mob of people to capture 3 monsters that are around your town.  First one to capture 3 monsters wins the game.

The game is an 18 card deck, with 14 of those cards in play.  Each card has 2 values on it, a pitchfork or a torch.  You collect the totals you need to capture the monster.  Once you have captured it, you move onto the next monster, and start collecting your angry mob of pitchforks and torches again.

Name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder in the Wild West
Description:
Ten years ago Sheriff P shooter was made sheriff of Dodgy city and helped to clean up the town.  To celebrate the 10th anniversary of his appointment a party is being thrown at Lil's last chance saloon where there will be plenty of whiskey, women, gambling and music - yoo hah!  But before the party is in full swing, shots ring out and the Sheriff is found dead outside the saloon.

Host your own party to find out who was responsible for such a blast!

—description from the publisher

Name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder in the Thirties
Description:
Who shot Sam Shady? Rooseville, 1931. Sam Shady, private eye to the stars, is celebrating his birthday in style. He’s invited all his current clients, as well as his closest rival, to dinner at his classy house. As his guests are getting to know each other before the first course arrives, Sam steps outside for a quiet smoke and shortly afterwards, he is found lying dead in the middle of his lawn. Find out who made Sam’s birthday go with a bang!

—description from the publisher

Name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder at Soft Rock Cafe
Description:
Raymond revue owner of the famous chain of restaurants/nightclubs is enjoying himself at a friends birthday party.  He is on medication to enable him to keep (it) up with his young girlfriend
but he suddenly keels over and dies.

Host your own party to find out who wanted to cut his line.

—description from the publisher

Name: Peer Programming
Description:
Two software developers on a single computer... If you want to be the first compiling and building your program, you will need big doses of caffeine, some undocumented shortcuts and maybe a few pokes. Obfuscate the code by hardcoding not-easy-to-remove constants and try to distract your peer with pizza... But, what if your program does not "exactly" fits the requirements? Well, let's see if we can sell this little bug as a brand new feature.

Peer Programming is an anti-cooperative game of software development for two players. 
The players take the role of software developers who want to write a pretty simple code which just prints a sequence of 6 characters on console. The source code is shared by both players but the requirements are different for each. The players take actions to modify the shared code towards meeting their requirements. The first player to make the shared code print the character sequence in his requirements wins the game.

The shared code is built using a tile placement mechanic based on the logic of code statements such as FOR loops, IF and PRINT. A player can draw motivation cards each time the shared code gets closer to meet his requirements (in the "compile" phase). These cards give one-turn special powers breaking the risk of stalemate and adding a fun thematic variation (distracting your opponent with pizza, asking for help in Stack Overflow, obfuscating the code...).

—description from the designer

Name: Project Swarm
Description:
How I expect the synopsis to sound when it's actually done:

Traverse caverns full of monsters, forests full of traps and towers full of rats.

This roguelike dungeon crawling adventure for 1 to 5 players features customizable characters, an innovative swarm mechanic, and endless fun.

Do you like old school Gauntlet? Experience? LOOT?
Players take on one of the 6 elemental playstyles. The Martial Knight, The Holy Priest, the Nature Druid, the Clockwork Gunslinger, the Shadow Necromancer, or the Arcane Mage are playable characters in the base game. And don't let that stop you from playing the way you want to play! Earn access to other classes through XP gain and continue to defeat wave after wave of enemy.

The game is a tactical exploration adventure where the players play cards to attack monsters. Each card played goes into a cooldown row to be used later, or the player can burn their highly coveted bits to cool them down faster. Through exploration, the players will reveal monster spawner tiles in search of the exit tile. Once the players decide to exit the dungeon they must face the second level, full of harder monsters and better loot. After exiting that level, the dungeon's boss must be defeated if the players wish to keep the loot they've gained thus far. If the players die at any time, they lose their gear and can try again.

The base game comes with (at least) two dungeons that are different each time you play. Completing a dungeon will allow you to purchase more gear for another run.

Honestly, we're still playtesting the hell out of this game, so everything here is subject to wild changes. Including the theme. I'm not 100% sold on fantasy.

Name: Turtle Wars
Description:
Turtle Wars is an original card game where Turtles and their ocean friends battle it out for freedom, honour, and gold.

The aim of the game is to gather Turtle Gold and defend it from the other players. You can gather gold peacefully or you can go to war to take it from your rivals by force.

The game uses a turn-based pick-up & play model, with a separate battle mode for warfare.

The deck is made up of 140 cards of which more than 100 are individual and unique designs (the rest are the gold)

—description from the publisher

Name: Mysterium: Hidden Motive
Description:
Mysterium. Hidden Motive

Revenge, jealousy, betrayal or just an accident?

“Hidden motive” allows you to go beyond finding the killer. Unravel truth behind dramatic events that happened to the main characters of Mysterium board game.

Expansion includes:
1 ghost's screen
24 motive cards

Name: Blindsight
Description:
Blindsight is a party game in which you can only see and play the cards that are in your opponents' hands. The main objective is to get rid of your own cards.

Blindsight is easy to learn as the basics are all about playing adjacent numbers and alternating the colours. You have to continue playing until there are no more cards to play, unless you can find a way to end your turn early. Which helps as you are trying to empty your own hand. When playing Blindsight in a group you will immediately notice there are always an extra pairs of eyes monitoring your every move, this give the game a cooperative feel.

There are four types of special cards in the game; they all have their own unique and usually quite surprising effect on the game. Cards that might help you the first time; can turn against you the next time you play them.

With the regular game play there are three additional variations to play. You can increase the difficulty by bringing the symbols found on the cards into play. Or you can play a last man standing variation in which you are trying to get rid of the opponents' cards instead of your own. Or combine both variations.

—description from the designer

Name: Sag's mir!: Demo Spiel
Description:
This is a demo game of the Repos family game Sag's mir (aka Time's Up)
It contains less cards than the original game and was given away as a promo at Spiel '15

Name: La Cosa Nostra: Guns For Hire – Verstärkung
Description:
5 new Gangster Cards for the La Cosa Nostra expansion Guns For Hire. 1 new character for each faction:
Omi Sakura - Yakuza
Andy Savage - Outlaws
Snake Sanchez - Bad Hombres
Ivanka Putinoff - Eastern Droogs
Avon Perell - Bloody Crips

Name: Mysterium: Prisoner of Time
Description:
ÐœÑ–ÑÑ‚ÐµÑ€Ñ–ÑƒÐ¼: ÐŸÐ¾Ð»Ð¾Ð½ÐµÐ½Ð¸Ð¹ Ñ‡Ð°ÑÑƒ ("Mysterium: Prisoner of Time") is the second expansion to the board game Mysterium, which introduces players to the streets of a strange town, located near the mysterious estate.


Sekretne podszepty is an expansion to Tajemnicze Domostwo adding 78 cards to the base game, including:

     12 Location cards, 
     12 Character cards, 
     12 Item cards,
     42 Dream cards.


The new cards are intended to be shuffled into their respective decks from the base game and greatly increase the replayability of Tajemnicze Domostwo.

—description from the publisher

Name: DunkelRunde
Description:
DunkelRunde is a timeless game characterized by its fairytale story, the interaction between the players and the material used. The game board, the characters and the box are made of wood. If you handle it carefully, Dark Round can still be played in 100 years.

Each player plays a girl and a boy. Players must reach a magical linden tree through fairytale scenes on the board. On the way to the tree, the game characters have to pass ghosts, giants, witches, dragons, and other fairy-tale sceneries. The game ends when a boy and a girl reach the linden tree. All players who have a child there at this point win the game. In this way it happens that not only one player alone is the winner.

The rules are explained by a story in the game manual or read on Youtube. In this way, players can better identify with the children they play.

Name: Munchkin Warhammer 40,000: Savagery and Sorcery
Description:
Munchkin Warhammer 40,000: Sorcery and Savagery is a 112-card expansion featuring one of the most iconic pairs of antagonists in the entire Warhammer 40,000 universe: Space Wolves and Thousand Sons.

The Space Wolves are an elite Imperial army, using genetic engineering and intense training to build a proud, deadly force. The Thousand Sons are the pride of Tzeentch, using sorcery to impose Chaos on the entire galaxy. Their battles are the stuff of legends and their heroes are revered millennia later. Now you can re-enact their stories.

—description from the publisher

Name: Elephant Combat Arena
Description:
Elephant is the name of a Gladiator Arena in the Middle-East. 15 Gladiators will compete for the trophy, but beware, the arena keeps it´s former champions to stop you.
Gameplay is a mix of Deck/Character building with Dice/Combat. The side-Missions is the other cool factor. A game from 2-4 players with the objective to attain 10 points, first player that gets 10 pts wins.

Name: 7TV: Apocalypse
Description:
7TV: Apocalypse is a standalone ruleset that uses the existing 7TV skirmish system.

So pick your apocalypse...

The rules allow play in ANY genre of apocalyptic setting you wish.


    You can chase your enemies across a desert with giant ants from the atomic age.
    Or try to outrun mohican-sporting marauders for the last drops of guzzoline. 
    Or maybe you want to face the zombie hordes in any number of undead holocausts from the black and white classics to the modern award-winning franchises they have spawned?
    You can fight for the very souls of mankind as angels or demons on Judgement Day.
    Or escape a bio-engineered nemesis in a virus-ravaged city. 
    Perhaps you have imagined some future dystopia ruled by the machines, simians or alien overlords – and want to break the chains of their oppressive regime?


All this and more is possible with 7TV:Apocalypse, providing hours of play across many genres.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: action engine (Crooked Dice Game Design Studio)

Name: Augen Auf!
Description:
One player is the quiz master and shows one of the contained 24 scenes for one minute to the other players. Afterwards the quiz master takes the picture away and poses questions of rising difficulty to the players.
They answer in secret whether the answer is "Wrong" or "Right". Depending on the difficulty of the question, the players who are right gain 1 - 3 points for their answer.
After all questions are answered, all players gain points on the main board, depending on how many points they achieved in the played scene. 
Whoever first reaches the final square on the main board, wins.

—user summary

Name: Who Goes There? Deluxe Edition
Description:
The Deluxe edition is the base game + both character expansions, so you'll get all 8 characters in one box.

Characters include McReady, Garry, Kinner, Copper, Van Wall, Norris, Clark and Blair.

Name: ImpeRunde
Description:
ImpeRunde is a tremendous wooden board game for 3-6 players. The colonial powers of the 18th century struggle for the control of the sea routes and influence in the colonies. If possible, they try to reach their goals in peace. But when diplomacy fails, conflict threatens. Excitement and interaction captivate the players for 3 to 8 hours. The game board with 80 cm in diameter, over 1.000 meeples and the game box are made of wood, the cotton bags are fairtrade! 
—description from the publisher

In Imperunde each player assumes the role of an eighteenth-century colony power. The goal of the game is, to be the first to set up a fixed number of trading posts and to have no debts as a colonial power. The count of trading posts is recommended by the rules according to the desired game length and number of players, but can be adjusted by the players. During the game, players must build new colonies, manage their national budgets, strategically shift armies, conduct diplomatic negotiations on war and peace, conquer other colonies, defend their own colonies, and plan and conduct their intelligence activity.

Name: Fates
Description:
Fates is strategic, puzzle, card game for 1 to 4 players.

The Moirai Sisters, also known as The Fates, are the personification of destiny. The three sisters are daughters of Zeus and responsible for controlling the life-thread of all mankind. Together, the sisters ensure that the fate of every individual takes its course without obstruction.

Clotho has the Spindle. She is responsible for spinning the life-thread. Clotho is bound with creating life.

Lachesis has the Measure. She is responsible for allotting the life-thread. These allotments represent the life span of an individual.

Atropos has the Shears. She is responsible for cutting the life-thread. This is when the life of every person comes to an end.

There are nine Moirai Cards, three of each Sister. The Moirai Cards are shuffled and dealt in a 3x3 'Moirai Grid'.

Shuffle the 18 Puzzle Cards and deal them face-up in three piles.

Each players' goal is to manipulate the Moirai Grid in order to match one or more of the topmost Puzzle Cards. Matching the Puzzle Card to the Moirai Grid allows you to claim the matched Puzzle Cards. The first player to claim an agreed number of Puzzle Cards wins.

—description from the publisher
